intro: Triumfetta brachystema, commonly known as the narrow-leaf triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and arid environments. Its small, elliptical leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. The species is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
